DISCLAIMER: THIS REVIEW IS ENTIRELY MY OPINION. DUH.

Audience:
☐ Good for when you're first entering the gaming market!
🗹 Good for the average person.
🗹 Good for someone who plays a lot of games for fun.
🗹 Good for professionals and hardcore players.
Pretty easy to grasp. The game teaches its mechanics in a clever way, and although the puzzles are tough at times it is fairly accessible to most audiences.

Graphics:
☐ The graphics made the game impossible to play, it was just so annoying.
☐ It's not bad, but not good either. It has no character to it. It's plain.
☐ Not the best in the world, but it was somewhat pleasant to look at.
🗹 Very pretty. Not perfect, but really helped immerse me into the game.
☐ Absolutely beautiful, almost like a work of renaissance art.
It looks good. I just have minor problems with it. [spoiler] Some parts of the game, like the enrichment center after GLaDOS fixes it are pretty boring to look at, though it makes sense. A lot of parts of the game look gorgeous, like GLaDOS' chamber and old Aperture.[/spoiler]

Music:
☐ Jarring, aggravating, not even in a good way.
☐ The music was okay, but it just had no character.
☐ Fits the themes well enough. That's about it though. 
🗹 Very nice to listen to, and could probably stand alone as its own thing.
☐ Absolutely amazing. 
The music changes according to different parts of the puzzles being activated, which is so clever and amazing, like [spoiler]when using the Excursion funnels, the beam sensors, and the gels.[/spoiler] The music is pretty good, especially later on[spoiler] like in old Aperture[/spoiler], and to top it all off the credits songs are amazing. Really nice!

Sound Design:
☐ Jesus christ, it sounds like a dialup modem on acid.
☐ It's okay, but really needs some improvements.
☐ A few odd sounds here and there, but mostly fine.
☐ Good at making it feel real, but it needs some more character to make it stand out.
🗹 Absolutely amazing and iconic.
The sounds are iconic. Everything from the portals to the cubes have their own sounds, and it all is unique and clever. Very nice.

Mechanics:
☐ Feels absolutely alien to play, and impossible to get used to.
☐ Some things just don't make sense, but it's okay.
☐ Fairly easy to grasp.
☐ Takes a bit to learn, but definitely worth it.
🗹 Feels snappy, and makes sense.
The way the game teaches you the mechanics is great, the game feels like one long tutorial, but in a good way. It slowly teaches everything to you in a way that makes sense without vomiting it at you all at once.

Controls:
☐ Controlling this game is a nightmare.
☐ Hard to learn, and a bit weird, but not awful.
☐ They work well enough.
☐ Sometimes it's tricky, but mostly good.
🗹 Feels snappy and to the point.
Controls are basic and simple. It makes sense.

Difficulty:
☐ A toddler could beat it.
☐ Pretty average.
🗹 Takes some thought.
☐ Hope you have the dexterity of a brain surgeon.
☐ This makes me want to destroy my computer it's so hard.
The puzzles are a bit tricky near the end, but it's not too bad. [spoiler]Fuck Wheatley's lab and everything it stands for. It's fucking aggravating. Also the ending of old Aperture is aggravating too. Maybe I'm just dumb, but those levels sucked. [/spoiler]Besides that, the puzzles were fun.

Story:
☐ What the fuck even happened?
☐ Disappointing, but at least it was somewhat cool.
☐ The story made sense, and was good enough.
🗹 Pretty nice, would read it if it were a novel.
☐ Absolutely amazing. Really makes you think.
It's not truly groundbreaking, but it's nice. The dialogue is witty and funny, the story makes some sense even if it is a bit wacky, and it's overall a nice experience.

Bugs:
☐ This game is one big bug.
☐ Some bugs can be really aggravating.
☐ It has bugs, but either they are hilariously good or they rarely show up.
🗹 Only encountered a few, they weren't too bad.
☐ Didn't encounter any bugs.
I personally didn't encounter any bugs besides one [spoiler]where if you crouch a certain way in an Excursion funnel, you can float through the air like a fucking wizard[/spoiler], but I've heard that bugs do exist for this. They don't seem too game breaking though.

Recommended price:
☐ Keep your credit cards and paypals far away from this thing.
☐ If you buy it, you better get a refund. Just saying.
☐ Wait for it to be on sale first.
🗹 Buy it full price! The devs deserve it!
☐ The game is already free.
Very good. Seriously recommend it. Give it a shot.

Дурак и Картошка
Неспроста заголовок звучит, как название басни. Ведь эта потрясающая игра ни что иное, как притча о предательстве, прощении и дружбе. На протяжении всего повествования Portal 2 будет удивлять забавными монологами, бросать в самые необычные ситуации и в самом прямом смысле доставлять удовольствие самим своим существованием.

[Плюсы]
+ На первый взгляд простой сюжет, за которым скрываются интереснейшие персонажи (сюда можно отнести даже Кейва Джонсона, чьи голосовые записи очень грамотно раскрывают его как персонажа), необычные сюжетные ходы и множество мелких деталей, которые можно спокойно пропустить;
+ разнообразные декорации в рамках одной лаборатории, которым позавидовала бы даже Чёрная Меза;
+ по сравнению с первой частью увеличенное многократно число механик, начиная от мостов плотного света, заканчивая различными гелями для изменения поверхностей;
+ кооперативный режим, который показался мне гораздо сложнее одиночной игры, что делает его только интереснее.

[Минусы]
- Довольно простая в плане геймплея битва с финальным боссом (если его можно так назвать).

[Итог]
Определённо одна из лучших игр, взлетевшая на несколько голов выше первой части, и точно стоящая прохождения. Кооперативный режим же только продлит удовольствия от испытаний.

游戏内容很棒，优点很明显， 作为一款解密游戏其中充满了各种奇思妙想，操作也并不复杂，不少关卡都让我产生“喔，原来还可以这样！”的惊叹，很适合在闲暇时间挑战一下自己的思维方式；我一口气玩了6个小时以后下定决心要通关他， 玩到9个小时的时候又暂时放弃了，不是因为太难走不下去，而是因为“晕”…玩游戏几乎不会晕的我，在这个游戏开始的时候就存在一种很轻微的眩晕感，它不足以让我立即放弃这个游戏，但是在游玩过程中始终伴随着我…另一个原因是流程太长了，[spoiler]  当我以为要接近尾声的时候剧情转折（这个转折还比较明显，简单地说就是电影一开始没多久你就知道你身边的这个人有问题，到中期他果然黑化了，后面的剧情就很老套，跟着之前的敌人合作携手又来打败你的老朋友，这个时候我就对接下来的剧情失去了兴趣，这个游戏变成了一个单纯的解谜游戏），大多数时候游戏流程长是一件好事（有更丰富的游戏内容和剧情），但是传送门的翻译有点糟糕，不着边际的对话和剧情提示让我只想通关（在这种心态下，看不到结局的关卡就像是无尽的试炼折磨着我）最后我放弃了…等到某天我又静下心来（大概有这么一天）的时候我会继续走下去。 PS：一个人玩几个小时解密真的有点无聊，找朋友一起玩或许会更加有趣…… [/spoiler]

Portal 2 offers some of the most amazing characters in videogame history. It builds upon and improves the original games by miles. The puzzles are nice but it is really the charactes and excellent writing that kept me hooked throughout the game. The jokes are on point and the voice acting is great. The game also offers some interesting plot twists and futher explores the world of the portal franchise. A must play for any gamer out there.

Lets say 20 instead of 6? Absolutely recommend it though!

YOU WIN,JUST GO.

Incredible. Much more involving and complex story-wise when compared to Portal (1). Offers more than double the gameplay hours story wise and the planning for the story seems more drawn out. Classic components of a beautiful story, humor, frustration, envy, confusion--they all work out great in this game. Gameplay wise its very similar to Portal however the areas are much larger, the puzzles more complex, and the atmosphere really painting out post-destruction of the aperture facility. Playing the prequel would of course benefit your in terms of understanding why things are the way they are, but I wasn't a huge fan of the original, you can squeeze by with a synopsis before going into this game.

 Its joy is in no way chained to its age, doesn't matter the year, enjoy it.

Coming from console and I heard learning keyboard+mouse takes a lot of practice. The majority of comments from a forum suggested Portal 2. I've never played Portal 1 but since the consensus said Portal 2, I made this my purchase. It does help with directional movement, jumps, crouch, grab. That seems like the basics of all games. So I'm glad this was recommended. The best part for me, THE AMAZING PUZZLE GAME! Love it! Portal 2 is really great. I'll get Portal 1 after this.
